Description: Painted limestone female shabti of Mer(?) with a lotus-headdress, a black lappet-wig, a modelled yellow face and a collar that envelopes the crossed hands in relief and yellow hoes; the leg section is inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead in six rows and one rear column of Hieroglyphic text; there is a red seed-basket at the back.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1992 Jul-Oct, Norfolk, Swaffham Museum, Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
